channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oldest serving US astronaut returns to Earth on 70th birthday
item.description: A capsule with Dan Pettit and his two Russian crewmates lands in Kazakhstan after a space station mission.

item.title: Cop's offer of a cigarette leads to a confession and a body: "Smokin' and jokin'"
item.description: When Aaron Friar and his teenage daughter, Ellie, go missing in Medford, Oregon, Det. Bill Ford takes one of the suspects out for a cigarette break. I...

item.title: Thousands join anti-Trump protests across US
item.description: Demonstrations, taking place on the 250th anniversary of the start of the American Revolutionary War, addressed a range of grievances.

item.title: Inside the rural Texas town where Elon Musk is basing his business empire
item.description: The tycoon and Donald Trump advisor has moved his businesses from California to a mostly rural central Texas county. What do the neighbours think?

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (April 20)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: Witness, 11, points to father's suspected killer: Sister's forbidden boyfriend
item.description: In an exclusive interview, with "48 Hours," Sierra Friar recalls the day her sister and father vanished.

item.title: Shining a light on Syria's civil war
item.description: Activist Mouaz Moustafa received thousands of photographs of civilians, allegedly tortured to death by the Assad regime, and shared them for the world...

item.title: From the 60 Minutes Archive: Wounds of War
item.description: From 2017, 60 Minutes reports on the Syrian government’s destruction of hospitals.

item.title: India's sword-wielding grandmother still going strong at 82
item.description: At 82, Meenakshi Amma is possibly the oldest woman to practise an ancient Indian martial art.

item.title: Arrests after 12 shot dead at Ecuador cockfight
item.description: Gunmen in fake army uniforms opened fire at a cockfighting ring, in a suspected gang-related attack.

item.title: White House solicits corporate sponsors for its Easter Egg Roll event
item.description: Corporate sponsors for the usually apolitical event held on the White House South Lawn include tech giants Meta, YouTube and Amazon.

item.title: Iran and the U.S. plan expert-level talks over Tehran's nuclear program
item.description: The two countries will begin having experts meet to discuss details of a possible deal over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program, the top Irania...

item.title: Opinion: When a hat becomes a threat
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the Chicago Bulls cap that is being cited as evidence of a deported Maryland man's gang membership.

item.title: Ukraine wary of Putin's Easter truce and says it will reciprocate only a genuine ceasefire
item.description: Ukraine said it would reciprocate any genuine ceasefire by Moscow, but voiced skepticism after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a temporary ...

item.title: She grew up believing she was a U.S. citizen. Then she applied for a passport
item.description: Among those fearful of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown are adoptees who grew up thinking they were U.S. citizens — only to find out y...

item.title: Takeaways from AP’s report on pardoned Jan. 6 rioters being embraced in Republican politics
A prince and knight fall in love and the Supreme Court is asked to intervene
item.description: Some parents in a suburban Maryland county want to pull their children from elementary school classes that use books featuring LGBTQ characters.

item.title: Some Jan. 6 rioters pardoned by Trump are now embraced as heroes and candidates for office
